title: Can prisoners write to prisoners in other jails? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the men's prision we write to female's in the woman's prision.Logically seems one can write to any imate in any prision.Once inmate puts sealed letter into postal mail box it is property of Federal Postal Mail System. The prision would need court order to meddle with it.Just need correct inmate name, number and prision adress . Of course it will be opened and read / scanned into computer at receiving prision.

I can only speak on the Federal system. My wife unfortunately got caught up in my case. The price for her freedom would have been me snitching. We decided together her doing 18 months was worth me not snitching. To get permission to write each other first you have to put in a request to staff member, in this case the unit counselor. He generally approves the request and forwards it to the warden. This has to be done at both prisons. When the process is over you can write each other as much as you want.

Within the Colorado DOC system, inmates may write to other inmates, in Colorado and other states, with specific institutional permission. For example, relatives may write to relatives, with institutional approval. For further mail procedures and permissions please see policy 300–38 at Policies
In Ohio, state Prison to state prison yes. It’s just scrutinized closer. As far as the federal BOP, or local county, I don’t know. I’m certain there are a mixture of right answers.

In America no…. Except if it’s immediate family who also in prison, jail. This is done through your counselors.. due to security.. it is forbidden through out the prison system that you have no contact with an inmate in another facility…

There was a time when you could but things have changed alot over the years. Now days no inmate to inmate mail. But many get around this by having a 3rd party living in the free world re-envelope the letter and foward to the other inmate

Not generally, however there are a few exceptions. If it is family and you submit a permission to correspond it is usually granted. One thing to keep in mind is that this also must be approved by both facilities.
In most cases, the answer is no. Prisoners are not allowed to correspond with other inmates unless they are close family members, in which case they have to get the permission of that prison warden.
Only if it's like a wife or your own kids..and that has to be approved through a caseworker. Or you piggy back the letters two someone on street and they mail out the letter for you.

In the UK, this is generally allowed by permission of the governor. In practice, most inter-prison letters are permitted unless there is a reason not to. It is not uncommon for people who have made freinds in prison to keep in touch when one of them is transferred.
Yes with their correct state and Federal ID numbers
